message.content:
<<<api>>>: Activity.setContentView
<<<code>>>: The issue is likely caused by a NullPointerException at line 28 of MainActivity.java. This means that there is a null object reference being accessed. You should check the code at that line and make sure that any objects being accessed are properly initialized.

Additionally, make sure that you have set the correct layout file using setContentView before accessing any views in your activity. It's possible that the crash is occurring because the views you are trying to access have not been inflated yet.

You can also try adding a try-catch block around the code in your onClickListeners to catch any exceptions and handle them gracefully. This can help prevent the app from crashing.

Finally, make sure that you have declared the necessary permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml file if your app requires any special permissions to run.

<<<explanation>>>: The crash is occurring because of a NullPointerException at line 28 of MainActivity.java. This means that there is a null object reference being accessed. You should check the code at that line and make sure that any objects being accessed are properly initialized. Additionally, make sure that you have set the correct layout file using setContentView before accessing any views in your activity.
